programs.name: Introduction to Internet Technologies and Web Programming
programs.description: This course introduces students to the basic architecture and protocols underlying the operation of the Internet with an emphasis on web design, web application programming, and algorithmic thinking. Students will gain a general familiarity with the Internet and learn how to create web applications.
programs.eligibility: Open to students with basic computer skills, no specific age requirement
programs.id: www.bu.edu_Introduction to Internet Technologies and Web Programming_0

programs.name: Introduction to Computer Science 1
programs.description: A rigorous introduction to programming for students intending to major or minor in Computer Science, Data Science, and related disciplines. Students will learn numeric, string, and list data, functions, recursion, iteration, and object-orientation through hands-on problem-solving and interactive examples.
programs.eligibility: Open to students with basic computer skills, no specific age requirement

programs.name: Introduction to Computer Science 2
programs.description: This course covers advanced programming techniques and data structures, including recursion, algorithm analysis, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, graphs, tables, searching, and sorting. Students will deepen their programming skills and understanding of data structures.
programs.eligibility: Prerequisite: Introduction to Computer Science 1 or equivalent experience

programs.name: Combinatoric Structures
programs.description: This course focuses on the representation, analysis, techniques, and principles for manipulation of basic combinatoric structures used in computer science. Students will develop rigorous reasoning skills and apply combinatorial concepts to problem-solving.
programs.eligibility: Prerequisite: Basic understanding of computer science concepts

programs.name: Probability in Computing
programs.description: This course introduces basic probabilistic concepts and methods used in computer science, emphasizing the role of randomness in computing. Students will learn how to apply probabilistic thinking to algorithm design and analysis.
programs.eligibility: Prerequisite: Combinatoric Structures or equivalent background

programs.name: AI Scholars
programs.description: AI Scholars program offers a deep dive into artificial intelligence through classroom instruction, research projects, and industry engagement. Students learn about computing, artificial intelligence, and participate in hands-on group projects.
programs.eligibility: Rising high school seniors, 16 years old by June 21, 2025, in 11th or 12th grade
programs.pricing: Fully funded, including tuition, housing, meal plans, and program-related field trips

programs.name: Cybersecurity & Digital Forensics Academy
programs.description: Students learn practical skills in cybersecurity, defending against cyberattacks, investigating digital crimes, and presenting findings in small teams. They also gain insights into the industry and career paths available.
programs.eligibility: Students entering grades 10–12 and recent high school graduates (ages 15-18)

programs.name: Artificial Intelligence Academy
programs.description: Explore the science of AI, ethics of AI-enabled automation, and global governance frameworks. Learn to define AI from a socio-technical perspective, summarize current scientific innovations, and propose design solutions in the AI domain.
programs.eligibility: High school students
programs.pricing: $3,525 including tuition, housing, and meals. Commuter Student tuition is $2,730.

programs.name: Computer Science and Programming
programs.description: Explore the fundamentals of computer science, programming languages, algorithms, and software development. Gain hands-on experience in coding, problem-solving, and building applications.
programs.eligibility: High school students ages 16-18 with a strong interest in computer science
programs.pricing: Cost varies based on program format

programs.name: Introduction to Robotics
programs.description: This program is perfect for students who want to learn introductory-level programming and apply what they've learned through real-life engineering projects. Students will test their coding and design skills by having their robot complete obstacle courses and other challenges.
programs.eligibility: Students with basic proficiency in programming

programs.name: Data Structures and Algorithms
programs.description: Designed for students with some proficiency at programming, this program dives deep into how computers organize and store data. Students will learn to design and utilize algorithms with peak efficiency.
programs.eligibility: Students with basic proficiency in programming

programs.name: Computer Science Summer Program
programs.description: Intensive program covering fundamental concepts in computer science including algorithms, data structures, and programming languages
programs.eligibility: High school students interested in computer science

programs.name: Software Engineering Bootcamp
programs.description: Hands-on bootcamp focusing on software development principles, agile methodologies, and project management
programs.eligibility: College students pursuing a degree in computer science or related field

programs.name: Data Science Summer Institute
programs.description: Comprehensive program covering data analysis, machine learning, and data visualization techniques using Python and R
programs.eligibility: Graduate students or professionals with a background in statistics or programming

programs.name: AI and Machine Learning Workshop
programs.description: Hands-on workshop exploring artificial intelligence, neural networks, and deep learning algorithms
programs.eligibility: Undergraduate students with a strong foundation in mathematics and programming

programs.name: Web Development Bootcamp
programs.description: Intensive bootcamp covering front-end and back-end web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, and React
programs.eligibility: High school or college students interested in web development

programs.name: Game Development Summer Program
programs.description: Interactive program teaching game design, development, and programming using popular game engines like Unity and Unreal Engine
programs.eligibility: High school students with an interest in game development

programs.name: Computer Science for Cyber Security
programs.description: Students will learn the fundamentals of computer science with a focus on cyber security, including cryptography, network security, and ethical hacking techniques.
programs.eligibility: High school students ages 15-18 with basic programming knowledge

programs.name: Programming with Python Bootcamp
programs.description: Intensive bootcamp covering Python programming language, data structures, algorithms, and web development using Django framework.
programs.eligibility: College students and professionals with some programming experience

programs.name: Data Science and Machine Learning Workshop
programs.description: Hands-on workshop on data science concepts, machine learning algorithms, and practical applications in real-world scenarios.
programs.eligibility: Graduate students and industry professionals in data analytics field
programs.id: k12stem.engineering.nyu.edu_Data Science and Machine Learning Workshop_19

programs.name: Web Development Bootcamp
programs.description: Intensive bootcamp covering front-end and back-end web development technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, and React.
programs.eligibility: High school students ages 16-18 with basic programming knowledge

programs.name: Game Development Workshop
programs.description: Introduction to game development using Unity game engine, covering game design principles, 2D/3D graphics, and game mechanics.
programs.eligibility: High school students ages 15-18 with interest in game design and programming

programs.name: Artificial Intelligence
programs.description: Students will gain an understanding of artificial intelligence (AI) and learn supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning algorithms. They will analyze algorithm strengths and weaknesses, mitigate bias, and apply mathematical concepts in Python programming with real-world datasets.
programs.eligibility: Grade 10-11 students
programs.duration: Session One: June 16, 2025 - June 27, 2025 | Session Two: July 07, 2025 - July 18, 2025

programs.name: Summer Computer Academy
programs.description: This week-long day camp teaches the foundations of computer programming using Python. It includes lectures on fundamental programming concepts and the Python programming language, along with hands-on experience in a computer lab.
programs.eligibility: Female students in grades 6-12, with or without previous programming experience

programs.name: Technology Day Camp
programs.description: A three-day summer camp providing an introduction to engineering and computer science through presentations and hands-on activities in a university environment. Offered free of charge for students in grades 6-8.
programs.eligibility: Students in grades 6-8

programs.name: Engineering Summer Academy at Penn (ESAP)
programs.description: Highly motivated high school students can experience rigorous college-level coursework in computer science, robotics, and engineering complex networks. The program combines theory with hands-on practical experience in cutting-edge technologies.
programs.eligibility: High school students

programs.name: Cyber Security Youth Pathway
programs.description: The Cyber Security Youth Pathway program introduces students to the fundamentals of cybersecurity, including network security, cryptography, and ethical hacking techniques.
programs.eligibility: High school students ages 14-18 with an interest in computer science and cybersecurity

programs.name: CyberSpartans Summer Camp
programs.description: Intensive online program providing a foundation in cybersecurity, covering topics such as Linux, computer networking, web security, encryption, and passwords. Campers also learn about cyber competitions, ethics, and careers in cybersecurity.
programs.eligibility: High school students interested in cybersecurity, no background needed

programs.name: AI Summer Training - DSIDSI
programs.description: Participants will engage in interactive live Zoom sessions, hands-on development projects focusing on reasoning agents, and guided learning materials including tutorials and code examples.
programs.eligibility: Researchers, educators, students, and enthusiasts interested in AI and machine learning

programs.name: AI Summer Training
programs.description: Participants will engage in interactive live Zoom sessions, hands-on development projects focusing on reasoning agents, guided learning materials, and curated resources. They will learn how to build reasoning agents and explore the latest developments in AI tooling.
programs.eligibility: Researchers, educators, students, and enthusiasts interested in AI and machine learning

programs.name: Computer Science and Programming
programs.description: This program covers fundamental concepts in computer science, programming languages, algorithms, and data structures. Students will learn to design and implement software solutions to real-world problems.
programs.eligibility: Undergraduate students with a background in computer science or related field
programs.pricing: Cost of enrolling on this summer school program

programs.name: Data Science and AI Summer School
programs.description: This program covers topics in data science, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and their applications in various industries. Students will learn data analysis, predictive modeling, and how to implement AI algorithms.
programs.eligibility: Undergraduate students in their second year or above
programs.id: www.imperial.ac.uk_Data Science and AI Summer School_31

programs.name: UCL Computer Science Summer School
programs.description: Students learn about medical imaging computing, artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, virtual reality, robotics, and more. The program focuses on developing technical skills, critical thinking, problem-solving, and teamwork abilities.
programs.eligibility: Students enrolled in the ACOMPS programme and In2Stem participants

programs.name: Data Science Summer School
programs.description: Explore cutting-edge machine learning tools with courses on key data analysis methods, NLP, and statistical machine learning for large data.
programs.eligibility: Graduate students, professionals, consultants, researchers, and academics interested in machine learning and data science
programs.duration: Various courses offered from June to July 2025

programs.name: Data Science and AI Summer Program
programs.description: This program equips participants with essential Data Science and AI concepts relevant to business, preparing them to contribute to data-driven transformations and collaborate effectively with Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and Data Engineers.
programs.eligibility: Students of all backgrounds with an interest in Data Science and AI
programs.id: www.hec.edu_Data Science and AI Summer Program_34

programs.name: Machine Learning Deep Learning
programs.description: Intensive program covering deep learning techniques and applications in various fields such as computer vision, natural language processing, and reinforcement learning.
programs.eligibility: Open to Bachelor, Master, PhD, and Postdoc students with a background in computer science or related fields.

programs.name: Machine Learning Reinforcement Learning
programs.description: Focused program on reinforcement learning algorithms and their applications in autonomous systems, robotics, and game playing.
programs.eligibility: Open to Bachelor, Master, PhD, and Postdoc students with prior knowledge of machine learning concepts.

programs.name: Machine Learning AI Natural Language Processing
programs.description: Comprehensive program focusing on natural language processing techniques, sentiment analysis, and chatbot development using AI algorithms.
programs.eligibility: Open to Bachelor, Master, PhD, and Postdoc students interested in AI and language processing.
programs.id: www.unibe.ch_Machine Learning AI Natural Language Processing_37

programs.name: Hands-on Learning for Emerging Technologies in Electronics Engineering
programs.description: This program is specifically designed for students with an engineering background and covers cutting-edge areas such as Artificial Intelligence of Things, Wireless Communications & Microwave, Smart Vehicles, along with Chinese language and culture practices.
programs.eligibility: Non-Chinese citizens with English proficiency (IELTS≥ 6.0 or TOEFL≥ 85 or equivalent)
programs.id: isc.bit.edu.cn_Hands-on Learning for Emerging Technologies in Electronics Engineering_38

programs.name: Frontiers of Materials Science for Renewable Energy
programs.description: Students will explore materials science within the field of renewable energy through lectures and laboratory practices covering topics such as Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cells, Lithium-Ion Batteries, and Photovoltaic Devices.
programs.eligibility: Non-Chinese citizens with English proficiency (IELTS≥ 6.0 or TOEFL≥ 85 or equivalent)
programs.id: isc.bit.edu.cn_Frontiers of Materials Science for Renewable Energy_39

programs.name: Artificial Intelligence Summer Program
programs.description: An academic exchange and practical innovation program focusing on artificial intelligence, including visits to the Integrated Circuits Center and well-known Chinese enterprises to understand AI technology applications.
programs.eligibility: Non-Chinese citizens with English proficiency (IELTS≥ 6.0 or TOEFL≥ 85 or equivalent)

programs.name: Artificial Intelligence: Leading the Frontier
programs.description: This program focuses on the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, including machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, and computer vision.
programs.eligibility: Open to undergraduate, Master, and PhD students with a fluency in English and an interest in AI.
programs.duration: Varies by theme, check program details for specific dates

programs.name: Computer Science Empowering Health
programs.description: This program explores the intersection of computer science and healthcare, covering topics such as health informatics, medical imaging, and bioinformatics.
programs.eligibility: Open to undergraduate, Master, and PhD students with a fluency in English and an interest in healthcare technology.
programs.duration: Varies by theme, check program details for specific dates
